availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Samuel F. Pollock (Mason County, Kentucky, justice of the peace and trustee)

body.p: Mason County, Kentucky, justice of the peace and trustee. Kentucky native. Married to Mary Ann McLean Pollock. Father of Fannie Pollock, Anstranada Pollock, and Mary F. Pollock. Justice of the peace in Mason County in 1860. Owned six enslaved persons in 1860. Member of the Board of Trustees of Germantown, Kentucky, in 1864.

bibl.p: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Mason County, District 3, p. 77; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, District 3, p. 16; Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Bracken County, Germantown, p. 4; Find A Grave, "Samuel Pollock (1813-1885)," Memorial #65828713, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=65828713&ref=acom (accessed May 24, 2017).
